title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 16
author: Various
snippet: On the right of the king, who was splendidly armed, and rode atall grey horse, presented to him by Lord Lindsay, was that venerablewarrior and the Earl of Crawford, commanding a noble body of cavalry,consisting of the chivalry of Fife and Angus; while on his left LordRuthven, with the men of Strathearn and Stormont, formed a body ofnearly five thousand spearmen.

title: Wilson's Tales of the Borders and of Scotland, Volume 16
author: Various
snippet: The boldness of these proceedings, quadrating with theweakness of the king's actions, spread disaffection among the people ofScotland far and wide; and it was soon rumoured that the monarch, afraidof the disposition of his subjects towards the south, had proceeded toAberdeen, and issued orders for the array of Strathearn and Angus, andall his friends in the north who still retained their allegiance.

title: Four years in Great Britain.
